text.section: Except as provided in subsection (b)(1) of this section, an insurance contract or annuity contract shall contain the standard provisions required under this article.

section.section:
The Commissioner may waive the required use of a provision in an insurance policy or contract form if the Commissioner:
finds that the provision is unnecessary to protect the insured or is inconsistent with the purposes of the policy; and
approves the policy.
A required standard provision may not be waived by agreement between an insurer and another person.

text.section: The Commissioner may approve a substitute provision in an insurance policy or annuity contract if the provision is not less favorable than the required provision to the insured, annuitant, or beneficiary.

Instead of a provision required by this article, a foreign insurer or alien insurer may use a substantially similar provision required by the law of the foreign insurer's or alien insurer's domicile if the substantially similar provision does not conflict with the law of this State.
A policy or contract may not contain a provision that is inconsistent with a standard provision used or required to be used.
